body.p: STAFFORD, BENJAMIN, Private, Co. I, 26th New York Volunteers, was admitted to the Fairfax Seminary Hospital, Virginia, September 29th, 1862, with a gunshot wound over the right side of the frontal bone, received at Antietam. He was returned to duty May 8th, 1863. It was found, however, that the outer table of the os frontis was exfoliating, and the man was discharged from the service on May 28th, 1863. He was examined at Utica for a pension, by Dr. H. B. Day, April 22d, 1864. It was found that two fragments of bone had exfoliated, and that there was a fistulous sinus through which detached bone could still be felt.
